data.title: Djibouti
data.meta_description: AGOA Status: Djibouti is eligible for AGOA this year. Trade Agreements: The U.S. and the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA), which includes Djibouti, signed a Trade and Investment Framework Agreement (TIFA) in 2001. U.S.-Djibouti Trade Facts
data.text:
AGOA Status: Djibouti is eligible for AGOA this year.

Trade Agreements: The U.S. and the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA), which includes Djibouti, signed a Trade and Investment Framework Agreement (TIFA) in 2001.

Djibouti Trade Summary

U.S. goods exports to Djibouti in 2022 were $172 million, down 8.0 percent ($15 million) from 2021 but up 44 percent from 2012. U.S. goods imports from Djibouti totaled $42 million in 2022, up 30.3 percent ($10 million) from 2021, and up 257 percent from 2012. The U.S. goods trade surplus with Djibouti was $129 million in 2022, a 16.1 percent decrease ($25 million) over 2021.

Investment

Data on U.S. FDI in Djibouti are unavailable.

No data on Djibouti's FDI in the U.S. are available.
